metadata.Title: CVE-2020-23064 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Cross Site Scripting vulnerability in jQuery 2.2.0 through 3.x before 3.5.0 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the <options> element.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is a backwards-incompatible change that breaks existing software. See the upgrade guide for more info: https://jquery.com/upgrade-guide/3.5/  This may be a dupe of CVE-2020-11023

criterions.comment: jquery: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
